snippet: Since Timothy D. Cook became chief executive last summer, Apple has taken a number of significant steps to address concerns about how its products are made.
abstract: Apple, since Timothy D Cook became chief executive in summer 2011, has taken a number of significant steps to address concerns about how its products are made; he differs from his late predecessor Steven P Jobs by putting his stamp on labor issues; thanks to visit by Cook, Foxconn factory in China, where Apple products are made, vowed to reduce working hours and increase wages.
lead_paragraph: Since Timothy D. Cook became chief executive last summer, Apple has taken a number of significant steps to address concerns about how its products are made.

headline.seo: Apple’s Suppliers Pressed to Improve Workers’ Lot
headline.main: Apple’s Chief Puts Stamp on Labor Issues
